subject: Re: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
msgSnippet: ... Even if you cannot find the page, this is definitely a good idea. If you decide at a later time to have your test case extend something besides TestCase,
messageBody:
On 7/26/05, Dave Brosius <dbrosius@...> wrote:
> I have it in my head that the junit folks recommend always calling
> super.setUp/tearDown from a user declared setUp/tearDown, even if the JUnit
> test in question is directly derived from TestCase. However i cannot find
> any written (web page) recommendation to so. Is this still the case? Is
> there a documented recommendation some where?

Even if you cannot find the page, this is definitely a good idea. If
you decide at a later time to have your test case extend something
besides TestCase, your invocations of super.setUp/tearDown will
already be in place.
